medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) for 2 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started 2 days prior to admission and was diffuse, eventually localizing to the RLQ. The patient endorsed anorexia and nausea but denied emesis or changes in bowel function. She experienced a low-grade fever at home up to 100Â°F but had no chills. There were no mentioned aggravating or relieving factors.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Osteoporosis status post L2 compression fracture, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (diet controlled), Hypertension, Hypercholesterolemia, Colonic adenoma, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), hiatus hernia, previous upper endoscopy with Shatski's ring dilation x2, active neutrophilic esophagitis, remote history of mild tricuspid and moderate aortic regurgitation.
